cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 80 mi (125 km) east of Chetumal, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north today, move through the Yucatan Channel, then track north-northeast across the Gulf toward the Florida Panhandle before sweeping inland across Georgia and the Carolinas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Mexican coast from Tulum to Cabo Catoche (far southwest of GA)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Isle of Youth (far south of GA)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to Florida Panhandle, then inland across Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤7%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; scattered gusts possible late Wed into Thu
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Georgia coast given inland track and offshore winds
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could produce 2–4 in., locally higher, Wed night–Thu
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands as the system crosses Georgia
